intro: Sisymbrium falcatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The seeds are small and capsule-like, dispersing readily by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
